text: Peter Augustus Maier House, also known as the Maier-Pollard House , is a historic home located at Evansville, Indiana, United States. It was built in 1873, and is a 2 1/2-story, "L"-plan, Italianate style brick dwelling. It has a low-pitched slate cross-gable roof and features a bracketed cornice and paneled frieze. Also on the property is a contributing carriage house and original wrought iron fence. Note: This includes It was added to the National Register of Historic Places in 1982. ==References== Category:Houses on the National Register of Historic Places in Indiana Category:Italianate architecture in Indiana Category:Houses completed in 1873 Category:Houses in Evansville, Indiana Category:National Register of Historic Places in Evansville, Indiana
title: Peter Augustus Maier House
